thread.title: Arsenal midfielder Aaron Ramsey to miss a month of action
thread.title_full: Arsenal midfielder Aaron Ramsey to miss a month of action

author: paulmbanks
title: Arsenal midfielder Aaron Ramsey to miss a month of action
text:
Tweet 
Arsenal ‘s monumental, rejuvenating 2-0 victory over Bayern Munich in the UEFA Champions League group stages on Tuesday night came with a price. Important star midfielder Aaron Ramsey aggravated a hamstring injury while chasing down the ball. Arsenal Manager Arsene Wenger has ruled him out for at least a month. 
Prior to the Gunners fixture against Everton, Wenger said : “He [Aaron Ramsey] is alright but very down because he told me that his hamstring is quite a tough one. He’s out.” 
According to ESPN FC, Arsene Wenger doesn’t believe that Aaron Ramsey will return until after the next international break is completed in November. 
“[Ramsey] had a scan today but he’s out. I believe he will be out until after the next international break.” 
Aaron Ramsey has two goals and no assists on 9 shot attempts this 2015-16 season across all competitions. 
Ramsey and Arsenal are currently in second place in the Premier League table with 19 points. 
Paul M. Banks owns, operates and sometimes writes The Sports Bank.net , which is partnered with FOX Sports Engage Network. The website is also featured on News Now. Banks, a former writer for the Washington Times, currently contributes to the Chicago Tribune RedEye. He also appears regularly on numerous television and radio talk shows all across the country. Catch him Tuesdays on KOZN 1620 The Zone.
